name: Enigma Apartments & Suites

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008
reviews.text: I cannot think of anything but positive things to say about this place. The stuff was super friendly and helpful. They knew exactly what we needed and gave us great tips. Even before we arrived there I already developed a great communication with them and when we arrived they knew exactly who I was.
reviews.title: Dream you never want to end

likes.liked: — Unique style, View, Staff, Breakfast, Service
likes.disliked: — Lots of stairs to walk but it's a great workout

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All the rooms are unique. We stayed in the one at the bottom. The room was very cool with some interesting designs. Our bathroom was located on the bottom floor, I felt like I had to go down the cave.
reviews.title: Simply Amazing

likes.liked: — Views, views...did I mention we had our own jacuzzi to drink wine and look at the view?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008
reviews.text: And the view....just look at my pictures. Amazing views of Kaldera in the morning and sunsets.
reviews.title: The most beautiful views ever

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Did I mention they bring down to your room a delicious breakfast with freshly squeezed orange juice, warm croissants and many more things.
reviews.title: No such a place on earth !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Thank you for wonderful memories Enigma.
reviews.title: Absolutely Amazing

likes.liked: — Location, the room and the staff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: We spent 5 nights at Enigma in the middle of a 2-month trip with our 6 and 9-year-old boys. Enigma was everyone's favorite hotel! The boys did not even want to leave our gorgeous room and deck. From the incredible breakfast delivered to the room every morning, to the brilliant sunset enjoyed with the complimentary bottle of wine in the evening--it was all postcard perfect!
reviews.title: Heavenly!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Chris was charming, beautiful and helpful. She provided restaurant recommendations, arranged a rental car and airport transfers, suggested activites, and delivered our laundry. We were there in mid-March when many rooms, restaurants, and shops were not yet open. We did not find this to be a problem at all, and in fact loved feeling like we had the island to ourselves. Enigma is a gorgeous, friendly, charming hotel on a stunning islalnd. Be sure to check out the pictures!
reviews.title: A very nice hotel and excellent service!!Strongly Recommended!!~

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Me and another 3 friends went to Greece this easter. We had a pleasant stay in this hotel! It has a great view and their service is really perfect!!!
reviews.title: Beautiful room, very kind team and overwhelming view! A+++

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We had a champaign and a plate of fresh fruit free!!
reviews.title: Sensational place for a relaxing holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The lady in reception introduced some nice restaurants and places to visit. She's really nice by the way...
reviews.title: wonderful view and service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked this hotel due to the rating on Trip Advisor and we absolutely loved it. We booked it for our honeymoon so we would regard it as a special occasion hotel.
reviews.title: Great front desk staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Chrisoula, manager of front desk set the scene by giving at a lot of good advice. Being Australian's the Euro means everything on Santorini is very expensive. Chrisoula gave us great advice about local restaurants so we ended up eating very well and did not feel we were tourist fodder!
reviews.title: the warmest staff!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: The first room we had was room one which is behind the office - it was definitely big enough for two people. Amazing views, but no balcony. We went to the cafe directly upstairs.
reviews.title: lovely boutique hotel with great views and staff

likes.disliked: — having to stay only for 3 days

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: For the last few nights we upgraded to I think room 8. It was huge - large enough for a family! Great balcony with a spa - very indulgent.
reviews.title: Wonderful hospitality transformed our stay

likes.liked: — The hospitality we received from the staff
likes.disliked: — That the patio was very small and not really private

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008
reviews.text: We were wondering if Fira would be too busy, but you really can escape the busy-ness at the Enigma it is in a really great location.
reviews.title: PERFECT HONYMOON

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: There are many many hotels to choose in Santorini. As a first time traveller to the beautiful island, we were spoilt for choice. There are also a number of key considerations such as location, the view you want and the crowds. In general, Fira is a good place to stay for those who wants some night-life and shopping. Next to Fira is Imeroglivi, which is a lot quieter and also with some stunning views from the hotels there. The hotels there also tend to be slightly more expensive and upmarket.
reviews.title: Chrisoula makes all the difference

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Oia is further away but has stunning sunset views from most of the hotels. The accomodations there seem to be more modern and on the higher end of the spectrum. For a great quiet and romantic honeymoon, I would probably choose one of the nice (but expensive) hotels in Oia.
reviews.title: Amazing Views; Exceptional Service!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Since I was travelling with a group of friends, I decided to pick the Enigma in Fira, partly due to the nearness to the night-life but also on the strength of the TripAdvisor reviews. For sure, me and my friends have NO regrets with our choice. One of the key reasons was the location with a perfect and beautiful view of the sea and nearby islands, and Chrisoula. She is the "one woman show" of the hotel - reception, manager, concierge, coordinator, etc. Prior to the stay, she was most responsive in terms of e-mail queries, etc. When you first step into the Enigma, you feel as though you are being welcomed to your own home. Chrisoula makes you feel so at ease and welcomed. She is quite amazing. She knows everything about Santorini!
reviews.title: Meeting Chrisoula made our whole trip better.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: There are only 8 rooms in the Enigma and from what I can see, all are nicely furnished and comfortable with a distinct Greek feel to them. Our room was a "Jacuzzi Suite" with 2 floors. It was spacious for 4 adults and came with an outdoor heated jacuzzi that can fit 3-4 persons comfortably. The beds are about average in size and firmness and comfort. However, what was breathtaking was the view we got of the sea and nearby islands.
reviews.title: Perfection!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: Breakfast was served in your room though the choices of items are limited. Hence, after a few days, it can get a bit boring to eat the same breakfast day after day.
reviews.title: First class

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We enjoyed a wonderful week in Santorini in May, in large part because the Enigma exceeded our high expectations. The hotel is perfectly located on the main pedestrian clifftop street in Fira. There are restaurants, shops of all kinds, art galleries and attractions such as the cathedral, donkey rides and cable car to the old port within steps of the hotel. The Enigma is built into the side of the cliff in traditional ' cave' style so the open air cafe, the reception area and each of the 8 unique rooms and suites are accessed by a series of steps leading down the cliff. There is an amazing view of the caldera from almost anywhere in the complex.
reviews.title: Exceeded our High Expectations.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in Jacuzzi suite #6. It was bright, spacious and attractively decorated with sturdy, casual furniture and a few antiques. The kitchenette had all the appliances,dishes and utensils to prepare simple meals. There was a large shower stall in the bathroom. Both loft bedrooms had low curved ceilings and short guard rails and the one at the back of the suite was accessed by a ship's ladder so it was necessary to use some caution when moving around, entering or exiting the rooms. Both contained a comfortable double bed with medium-firm mattress.
reviews.title: Best hotel ever!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Outside # 6 there was a small furnished patio with the jacuzzi and a mini garden. Beyond it there was the main staircase ,a larger patio for all hotel guests, and, of course, the glorious view Santorini is famous for .
reviews.title: A dream place to stay in Santorini

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Given the hotel's central location and configuration, the density of buildings on the cliff face and the amount of construction going on in Fira, it was remarkably quiet and serene on the patios .
reviews.title: Amazing!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: As most reviewers have mentioned, the staff at the Enigma are exceptional. They are friendly, extremely competent and wonderfully efficient. Chris, the manager, supplied us with great suggestions on things to see and do in Santorini and every one of her restaurant suggestions was a hit. She lent us a laptop to use during our stay and tracked down a wayward package from home. She even arranged for Armando to drive us to a restaurant for our anniversary dinner and then surprised us there with a beautifully decorated cake and a bottle of wine. Eddie prepared and delivered fresh, tasty, bountiful breakfasts to our patio every morning. Anna kept our suite spotless and laundry and drycleaning sent out by 10 AM was back by 2 PM...the same day! Minor issues like adjusting the water temperature in the jacuzzi and fixing the freezer in our fridge were responded to within minutes.
reviews.title: Dream Destination!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: My friends and I got lucky when looking for a good place to stay in Santorini in 2007. We loved it so much then we decided to repeat the trip and bring more friends in 2008. The hotel's location is right in heart of town, with THE view of the sunset in FIRA and a few minutes walk to everything you'd need although be warned that may not matter since you may not want to leave your balcony :). I'm sure there are comparable hotels in Santorini but what brought us back and will continue to do so is the staff. Chrisoula, the hotel's manager and our friend has built a team that provides a level of service which explains why you need to book months in advance to stay here. Any time I'm in Fira, there is no question where me or my friends would stay.
reviews.title: Another amazing stay at Enigma

likes.liked: — Our suite was beautiful, breakfast on the balcony every morning, our balcony had the best sunset view, the staff was amazing.
likes.disliked: — That I had to leave it and come back to reality.

reviews.title: "Poleeee O Ray Yah!!!" Very Very Nice
reviews.text: What can I say except simply wonderfull! This was the second summer in a row a group of friends from Canada and Denver got together on the beautiful island of Santorini. And I believe there is not a better place on the island to stay than Enigma. The location is right in the heart of the Caldera overlooking the old port, the volcano and of course the majestic sunsets. I dont believe there is a bad view from any of the rooms. The service is second to none, Chrysoula and her staff are the best. They look after your every need and are always there to recommend a must see site a tour, or where to get a fantastic meal.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: We truly enjoyed our stay once again and hopefully next summer we can make it a three-pete!
reviews.title: Nice Place - Items to Consider

likes.disliked: — Underwelming interior, lack of hot water, little to do in the area

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Your Friends from Canada and Denver!!!! "poleee o-ray- yah!!!!"
reviews.title: The Mystique of Enigma Wraps You in Warmth

likes.liked: — Staff and views of the Caldera

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spiros, George, Michael, Nick, Sophia, Peter, James and Amy!!!
reviews.title: Loved our stay at the Enigma

likes.liked: — the view, the location, the staff- what's not to like?

reviews.title: A Must for your Travel "To Do"List
reviews.text: Enigma Apartments? Just do it! They are all the reviewers said they would be plus some, because words are no substitute for being there. We found Enigma Apartments on tripadvisor.com in May this year and were convinced by the reviews of the accommodation and staff. We’re glad to say we were not disappointed, and our holiday turned out to be more than we expected.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Btw, we apologise in advance for the sunset photos posted but, hey, it’s what Santorini is famous for so go with the flow. Besides, in our initial e-mail contact I suggested to Chrisoula that the famed Santorini sunsets might struggle to compete with the sunsets over the white beaches of Western Australia. Now I’m not so sure.
reviews.title: The best kept secret in Santorini..

likes.liked: — Welcoming staff, unbelievable view, total chillout.
likes.disliked: — A pool would be nice but there Santorini isn't really the place for them anyway.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Chrisoula and her staff looked after us from the time we were picked up from the airport to the time we were dropped off (we recommend the airport transfer organized by Enigma). She has a resident Superman who not only takes the stress out of getting your cases to and from your apartment, but also sorts out TV signals that have dropped out after a lightning storm at 9.00pm at night. The cleaning and service staff are friendly and helpful, the apartment clean and totally met our needs, and there was a laptop available for us to check e-mails, catch up with the world, and do online check-ins for other travel plans. Breakfast is an absolute must as it follows a courtesy call to check that you are ready for it at the time you asked for it when you ordered it the day before.
reviews.title: Beautiful views over the caldera

likes.disliked: — The fact that our terrace was not at all private

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We’ve drunk cold beer from a private balcony in Port Douglas looking over the Pacific Ocean through palm trees, watched the sunset over the Indian Ocean with a glass of champagne after a day swimming with whale sharks, seen the Milky Way at night in red dirt country 1,000 kms from civilization in northwest Australia, and watched the sunrise over the jungle in Papua New Guinea. I have to say that it doesn’t get any better than a private balcony at Enigma Apartments watching the sunset over the caldera with a glass of cold white Santorini wine (light, not too fruity, excellent) from the complimentary bottle, with some local cheese, olives, and crackers (from the local supermarket).
reviews.title: Great experience, breathtaking view

likes.liked: — Great location, beautiful view, great service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were told that Santorini is really “touristy” and Fira expensive. Yes to both, and it was pretty manic when the cruise ships hit town, but none of this failed to change how much fun it was, neither did the rain or the lightning storm on day 2. Chrisoula provided us with some great information about what to do, where to go, and where to eat without spending vast amounts. We tried all but two of her recommendations and were not disappointed – thanks Chrisoula.
reviews.title: Couldn't have had a better experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I was astounded by the hospitality and the accomadations! Chris the owner/manager speaks perfect english and greeted us when we arrived. She answered all of our questions about activities on the island: what was open, when was the best time to go, how to get there, etc.. The other staff is unobtrusive, helpful, and extremely friendly.
reviews.title: Grandiose experience matched only by the sunset view.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The town Fira is on a cliff face, so be prepared to walk up and down steps! It is a small town that is easy to get around with a pedestrian square and several streets at the core; there are no street signs, so when you first get there you may find yourself making a few u-turns. It took us a while to find the hotel, but it was well worth it! The entrance to the hotel is situated off the top pedestrian street that faces out over the cliff, so when you get to town park as close as you can to the main church at the top. Then just walk along the top pedestrian street. Enigma is but several meters down. Go down the stairs to alert them you have arrived, and a porter will come up to help you with your luggage.
reviews.title: Perfect Honeymoon Getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The rooms are well proportioned and filled with amenities (including a complementary bottle of wine). You can place your order each evening for breakfast to be brought to you when you want in the morning; I recommend the Greek yogurt! Each group of suites has a little patio for you to have some privacy, and there is also a larger patio to gather with more friends. Some of the rooms have spas as well.
reviews.title: Relaxing; friendly; clean; beautiful sunsets

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the moment my wife and I entered the Enigma Apartments, we felt at home . . . if your home is carved into the side of a cliff in one of the most beautiful locations on the planet. Chris, our host, was wonderful. She had great recommendations for food and site seeing, helped us find our way around, and rented a car for us in about 10 minutes from when we asked (for about 2/3 of the cost of the other rental places.
reviews.title: Jaw-Dropping Views, First class service - room satisfactory - but located in super touristy Thira...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfasts were enormous and delicious. The bed was a little hard, but the room was very unique and enjoyable. Our cave shower was also quite fun. We have stayed in fancier places for the price, but you are paying for location and view. If you have mobility issues, this is not the place for you . . . lots of stairs and narrow doorways, but then you might want to steer clear of Santorini all together as that is the case for the whole island.
reviews.title: excellent quality

description: The Enigma Hotel in Santorini (Apartments & Suites) is perched on the cliff side of western Santorini, in the heart of Fira, the capital of Santorini island. Its wonderful location provides its guests with a spectacular view of the famous Santorini volcano and Caldera complex, the Aegean Sea, the island’s traditional old port and, best of all, the celebrated Santorini sunset. This view, along with the hotel’s excellent service and facilities, places it as a fine Santorini hotel in Fira.The Enigma Fira Santorini luxury hotel provides an amazing atmosphere for your holidays in Santorini. Enigma’s luxury Santorini suites, apartments and studios are elegantly-designed and feature a plethora of modern amenities that fuse harmoniously with the charming island-style architecture, creating one of the most picturesque hotels in Santorini.
